snippet: The Harvard Law Review has long claimed credit for creating The Bluebook, but a new article from two librarians at Yale Law School says the idea originated in New Haven.
abstract: Adam Liptak Sidebar column notes archival research conducted by Yale Law School librarians Fred R Shapiro and Julie Graves Krishnaswami determines provenance of uniform citation manual The Bluebook, long a staple of freshman year for American law students; researchers determine 582-page style manual originated at Yale, not Harvard as long believed; article on findings will be published in Minnesota Law Review.
lead_paragraph: The Harvard Law Review has long claimed credit for creating The Bluebook, but a new article from two librarians at Yale Law School says the idea originated in New Haven.

headline.print_headline: Yale Finds Error in Legal Stylebook: Contrary to Claim, Harvard Didn’t Create It
headline.main: Yale Finds Error in Legal Stylebook: Harvard Did Not Create It
